allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: Dutch Freelance Administration Automation App

Comprehensive Streamlit application for automating receipt processing,
VAT calculations, and tax administration for Dutch freelancers.

Features:
- Smart receipt upload with OCR (Tesseract) and AI (Google Gemini)
- Dutch tax compliance (VAT rates: 9%, 21%)
- Expense categorization and tax deductions
- Interactive dashboard with analytics
- Export functionality (Excel, CSV, JSON)
- Quarterly VAT declaration reports
- Multi-language support (Dutch/English)

Built with Streamlit, SQLAlchemy, and modern Python practices.

ðŸ¤– Generated with Claude Code

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
Bash(gh repo create dutch-freelance-automation --public --description "Streamlit app for automating receipt processing and tax administration for Dutch freelancers" --source .)
Bash(pip install streamlit streamlit-option-menu sqlalchemy python-dotenv pillow pandas plotly)
Bash(timeout 5 echo "Waiting for app to start...")
Bash(pip install passlib bcrypt python-jose google-generativeai openpyxl)

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Update CLAUDE.md with accurate architecture documentation

Major improvements to project documentation:
- Corrected architecture from 3-layer to 4-step Gemini processing pipeline
- Fixed directory structure (modules/ not pages/)
- Added Data Flow section explaining component interactions
- Documented actual tax calculation formulas with code snippets
- Added Database Migrations section with Alembic commands
- Added Common Development Tasks section with step-by-step guides
- Added Streamlit navigation patterns
- Enhanced troubleshooting section with specific solutions
- Clarified Gemini API is required (no fallback)
- Added GDPR compliance details and Dutch tax law specifics

The documentation now accurately reflects the codebase''s Gemini-only
processing approach and provides practical guidance for development.

EOF

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Major refactor: Migrate to Gemini-only processing pipeline

This commit includes significant architectural changes and improvements:

## Architecture Changes
- Migrated from pages/ to modules/ directory structure
- Implemented 4-step Gemini Vision processing pipeline
- Removed dependency on Tesseract OCR for primary processing
- Streamlined receipt processing workflow

## New Features
- Gemini Vision API for direct image-to-text extraction
- Enhanced PDF text extraction for digital receipts
- Improved Dutch tax categorization with LLM
- Better error handling and logging throughout pipeline

## Files Changed
- Renamed pages/ â†’ modules/ for better organization
- Updated app.py with new module imports
- Refactored services/llm_service.py for 4-step pipeline
- Updated services/processing_pipeline.py for Gemini-only flow
- Enhanced services/ocr_service.py (legacy, kept for reference)

## Documentation
- Added FIXES_COMPLETED.md and FIXES_SUMMARY.md
- Preserved old versions (_old.py) for reference
- Updated all imports and references

## Technical Details
- Step 1: Image/PDF â†’ Raw Text (Gemini Vision or PyPDF2)
- Step 2: Raw Text â†’ Structured JSON (Gemini parsing)
- Step 3: Structured Data â†’ Category (Gemini classification)
- Step 4: Category â†’ Tax % (Python rule-based)

This migration improves accuracy and reduces dependency complexity
while maintaining full Dutch tax compliance features.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
